column2: TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: Frequency of lab testing as per Table 1.4.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Lab testing sent to Engineer for approval prior to placement of fill. Lab testing requirements as per Table 1.5 and Table 1.6, and KiwiRail standard C-ST-FO-4110.
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: 100% of subgrade
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Subgrade free of debris, organics and unsuitables
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: 100% of subgrade
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: <5 mm deflection under a smooth drum roller
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: Scala testing every 10 m as per Section 1.5.6
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer must inspect and agree required formation treatment or undercutting. CBR requirements as per Section 1.5.6.
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: Each fill material type
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Compaction trial carried out to confirm compaction methodology and compaction standards can be met, refer Section 1.8.2.
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: Frequency as per Table 1.4
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer notified and given the opportunity to inspect when fill testing occurs.Compaction requirements as per Table 1.3
Visual inspection of finished structural fill surface
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: 100% of structural fill surface
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer notified and must be inspected prior to next fill layer being placed. Well compacted surface and 3% fall to outside edge
Visual inspection of finished sub-ballast level
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: 100% of sub-ballast surface
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer notified and must be inspected prior to next fill layer being placed. Well compacted surface and 3% fall to outside edge
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: Finished section of structural fill or sub-ballast level
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer notified and given the opportunity to inspect when level checks on finished surface are being completed
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: 100% of batter faces
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer notified and should inspect completed matted/hydroseeded area
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: Placement of all geotextile
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer notified and given the opportunity to inspect
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: Placement of all geogrid
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer notified and given the opportunity to inspect
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: All drainage trenches (subsoil drainage)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer notified and must inspect prior to backfilling of the drainage trench
INSPECTION BY: PM/PE/ Engineer/ Site Supervisor
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: Visual inspection of swale
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer notified and must inspect finished surface
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: Finished section of duct prior to backfilling
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer notified and given the opportunity to inspect.Duct laid according to the Specification and KiwiRail Standard S-ST-CW-2140

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: As-built drawings to be provided to the Engineer following completion of works. Tolerances as per the Specification. Where tolerances differ from the Specification they shall be agreed with the Engineer prior to completion of the works
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: Each 20 Linear meters for each lane
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Density >= 95% mean, Density >= 92% minimum
TASK TIMING OR TASK FREQUENCY: Each 20 Linear meters for each lane
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Density >= 98% mean, Density >= 95% minimum
All works completed, records attached and work conforming
